Key Match Events: Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill started the match with two fours and a six each in the opening two overs
Washington Sundar picked up three wickets, including two in his first over, for 15 runs
Dion Myers hit an unbeaten 65 to lead Zimbabwe's fight
Ravi Bishnoi took a spectacular flying catch at backward point to dismiss Brian Bennett
Pre-Game Insights: India's return of three players from the T20 World Cup-winning squad forced a change in India's tactics
Abhishek Sharma and Ruturaj Gaikwad had to play out of positions at Nos. 3 and 4
Post-Match Reflections: Fielding makes the difference as India go 2-1 up against Zimbabwe
India's win was aided by a few missed half-chances, two dropped catches, and a plethora of misfields
Miscellaneous Highlights: India ended on 182, which was not below par at all, thanks to two half-century partnerships
India were beneficiaries of 31 runs according to ESPNcricinfo's ball-by-ball data
Others: India took a big step towards winning the five-match T20I series against Zimbabwe with a 23-run win in the third match to take a 2-1 lead
